title: Masroor Anwar
text:
Masroor Anwar (8 December 1944 – 1 April 1996) was a <a href="ghazal">ghazal</a> poet, film song lyricist and a film screenwriter. He wrote the lyrics for '<a href="Ko%20Ko%20Korina">Ko Ko Korina</a>', South Asia's first pop song, and working alongside <a href="Sohail%20Rana">Sohail Rana</a>, film director <a href="Pervez%20Malik">Pervez Malik</a> and film producer and actor <a href="Waheed%20Murad">Waheed Murad</a> in the 1960s, was part of the country's <a href="Cinema%20of%20Pakistan%23The%20Golden%20Era%20%281959%E2%80%931977%29">golden age of cinema</a> helping establish Karachi as a major hub for film production.
Early life and career.
He was born in 1944 in <a href="Shimla">Shimla</a>, <a href="Punjab%2C%20British%20India">Punjab, British India</a> and following the <a href="Partition%20of%20India">partition</a>, moved to Karachi, Pakistan. In Karrachi, he grew up to be a chubby and baby-faced young man. After finishing his basic education from <a href="Government%20Islamia%20Science%20College%2C%20Karachi">Government Islamia Science College, Karachi</a>, he worked for <a href="Pakistan%20International%20Airlines">Pakistan International Airlines</a> (PIA) for a short period and later for <a href="Radio%20Pakistan">Radio Pakistan</a> as a staff artist because of his deep interest in poetry and literature. At Radio Pakistan, he was helped by the film actor Ibrahim Nafees who introduced him to the film producer Iqbal Shehzad. He was hired by Iqbal Shehzad to write his first film song for his film "Banjaran" (1962). Then he became part of a group of four people in Karachi – <a href="Waheed%20Murad">Waheed Murad</a>, <a href="Pervez%20Malik">Pervez Malik</a>, <a href="Sohail%20Rana">Sohail Rana</a> and Masroor Anwar that made many big hit films together in the 1960s and 1970s.
Death and legacy.
He died in <a href="Lahore">Lahore</a> on 1 April 1996 at age 51. In the history of Pakistani cinema, Masroor Anwar was considered one of the best film song writers. Besides film songs, he also wrote some touching popular patriotic songs.
